Welcome

Downloading files from Google

Hire me because look at how easy I made it for you to search and extract through all those files on that cluttered shared company GDrive lol.

# libraries needed
library(readr)
library(googledrive)
library(dplyr)
library(purrr)
library(stringr)

options(httr_oob_default = TRUE)

# Logs in to Google Drive with user credentials
drive_auth()

# Saves the company team drive for easy reference 
company_drive <- team_drive_get("Insert Company Name Here")

# saving datapath
datapath <- "enter/desired/path/here"

Uploading files into Google

Finally got all the crap done and need to upload it into the drive?

# libraries needed
library(googledrive)
library(purrr)
library(tidyverse)

# allows google to have API access
options(httr_oob_default = TRUE)

# authorizes users email and session info
# run this to access google drive!!
drive_auth()

# select option 2
# when new tab pops open click work email, click allow, copy link
# paste into console

# get team drive directory
pfdrive <- team_drive_get("Company Name") # keep this line

# sets path for new specific folder for data

datapath <-drive_get("enter_googledive_folder_here/add_folders/if_needed", 
                     team_drive = "Company Name") # keep this line

# files saved on disk or in REnviron ------------------------------------------------
# get all files we want to upload in GDrive
local_files <- list.files("/enter/file/path/here/",
                          full.names = TRUE) # keep line

# creates the folder
folder <- drive_mkdir(name = "create_new_folder_in_google_drive",
                      parent = datapath) # do not change

map(local_files, drive_upload, path = folder, verbose = F) # do not change


# repeat process as necessary

Now you can be less stressed when someone asks for a file lol. Just run the script for two seconds after filling in the gaps! Let R do all the searching ~~
